amphitheatre.gloss: a sloping gallery with seats for spectators (as in an operating room or theater)
an oval large stadium with tiers of seats

amphitheatrum flavium.gloss: a large amphitheater in Rome whose construction was begun by Vespasian about AD 75 or 80

amphiuma.gloss: aquatic eel-shaped salamander having two pairs of very small feet

ampicillin.gloss: semisynthetic penicillin (trade names Principen and Polycillin and SK-Ampicillin)

amplification.gloss: addition of extra material or illustration or clarifying detail
the amount of increase in signal power or voltage or current expressed as the ratio of output to input

amplitude distortion.gloss: distortion that occurs when the output signal does not have a linear relation to the input signal

amplitude modulation.gloss: modulation of the amplitude of the (radio) carrier wave

ampoule.gloss: a small bottle that contains a drug (especially a sealed sterile container for injection by needle)

ampul.gloss: a small bottle that contains a drug (especially a sealed sterile container for injection by needle)

ampule.gloss: a small bottle that contains a drug (especially a sealed sterile container for injection by needle)

amrinone.gloss: a drug (trade name Inocor) used intravenously in heart failure

amsinckia.gloss: rough annual herbs of Europe and the Americas: fiddlenecks

amsinckia grandiflora.gloss: annual of the western United States having large coiled flower spikes

amsinckia intermedia.gloss: annual of western United States with coiled spikes of yellow-orange coiled flowers

amsonia.gloss: genus of herbs and subshrubs with milky juice and showy bluish flowers

amsonia tabernaemontana.gloss: subshrubs of southeastern United States forming slow-growing clumps and having blue flowers in short terminal cymes

amsterdam.gloss: an industrial center and the nominal capital of the Netherlands

amulet.gloss: a trinket or piece of jewelry usually hung about the neck and thought to be a magical protection against evil or disease

amun.gloss: a primeval Egyptian personification of air and breath

amundsen.gloss: Norwegian explorer who was the first to traverse the Northwest Passage and in 1911 the first to reach the South Pole (1872-1928)

amur.gloss: an Asian river between China and Russia

amur privet.gloss: eastern Asian shrub cultivated especially for its persistent foliage

amur river.gloss: an Asian river between China and Russia

amusd.gloss: a doctor's degree in musical arts

amusement.gloss: an activity that is diverting and that holds the attention

amusement park.gloss: a commercially operated park with stalls and shows for amusement

amy lyon.gloss: English beauty who was the mistress of Admiral Nelson (1765-1815)

amygdala.gloss: an almond-shaped neural structure in the anterior part of the temporal lobe of the cerebrum

amygdalaceae.gloss: used in former classifications for plum and peach and almond trees which are now usually classified as members of the genus Prunus

amygdaloid nucleus.gloss: an almond-shaped neural structure in the anterior part of the temporal lobe of the cerebrum

amygdalus.gloss: used in former classifications for peach and almond trees which are now included in genus Prunus

amygdalus communis.gloss: small bushy deciduous tree native to Asia and North Africa having pretty pink blossoms and highly prized edible nuts enclosed in a hard green hull

amygdalus communis amara.gloss: almond trees having white blossoms and poisonous nuts yielding an oil used for flavoring and for medicinal purposes

amyloid plaque.gloss: a plaque consisting of tangles of amyloid protein in nervous tissue (a pathological mark of Alzheimer's disease)

amyloid protein plaque.gloss: a plaque consisting of tangles of amyloid protein in nervous tissue (a pathological mark of Alzheimer's disease)

amylum.gloss: a complex carbohydrate found chiefly in seeds, fruits, tubers, roots and stem pith of plants, notably in corn, potatoes, wheat, and rice

amyotonia.gloss: lack of normal muscular tension or tonus

amyotrophic lateral sclerosis.gloss: thickening of tissue in the motor tracts of the lateral columns and anterior horns of the spinal cord

amytal.gloss: the sodium salt of amobarbital that is used as a barbiturate

amaze.gloss: be a mystery or bewildering to

amplify.gloss: increase in size, volume or significance
to enlarge beyond bounds or the truth

amuse.gloss: occupy in an agreeable, entertaining or pleasant fashion

amaranthine.gloss: of an imaginary flower that never fades

amatory.gloss: expressive of or exciting sexual love or romance

amazed.gloss: filled with the emotional impact of overwhelming surprise or shock

amazing.gloss: inspiring awe or admiration or wonder

ambidextrous.gloss: marked by deliberate deceptiveness especially by pretending one set of feelings and acting under the influence of another

ambiguous.gloss: open to two or more interpretations

ambitionless.gloss: having little desire for success or achievement

ambitious.gloss: requiring full use of your abilities or resources

ameboid.gloss: like an amoeba (especially in having a variable irregular shape)

amendable.gloss: capable of being corrected by additions

amenorrheal.gloss: related to the suppression of normal menstrual flow for any reason other than pregnancy

amenorrheic.gloss: related to the suppression of normal menstrual flow for any reason other than pregnancy

amenorrhoeal.gloss: related to the suppression of normal menstrual flow for any reason other than pregnancy

amenorrhoeic.gloss: related to the suppression of normal menstrual flow for any reason other than pregnancy

amentaceous.gloss: (of plants) bearing or characterized by aments or catkins

amentiferous.gloss: (of plants) bearing or characterized by aments or catkins

amerindic.gloss: of or pertaining to Native Americans or their culture or languages

aminic.gloss: pertaining to or containing any of a group of organic compounds of nitrogen derived from ammonia

amiss.gloss: away from the correct or expected course
in an imperfect or faulty way

ammoniacal.gloss: pertaining to or containing or similar to ammonia

amnestic.gloss: of or relating to or caused by amnesia

amnic.gloss: of or related to the amnion or characterized by developing an amnion

amnionic.gloss: of or related to the amnion or characterized by developing an amnion

amniotic.gloss: of or related to the amnion or characterized by developing an amnion

amoeboid.gloss: like an amoeba (especially in having a variable irregular shape)

amorous.gloss: expressive of or exciting sexual love or romance

amorphous.gloss: having no definite form or distinct shape
lacking the system or structure characteristic of living bodies
without real or apparent crystalline form

amphibiotic.gloss: having an aquatic early or larval form and a terrestrial adult form

amphibious.gloss: relating to or characteristic of animals of the class Amphibia

amphiprostylar.gloss: marked by columniation having free columns in porticoes either at both ends or at both sides of a structure

amphiprostyle.gloss: marked by columniation having free columns in porticoes either at both ends or at both sides of a structure

amphiprotic.gloss: having characteristics of both an acid and a base and capable of reacting as either

amphistylar.gloss: marked by columniation having free columns in porticoes either at both ends or at both sides of a structure

amphitheatric.gloss: of or related to an amphitheater

amphitheatrical.gloss: of or related to an amphitheater

amphoteric.gloss: having characteristics of both an acid and a base and capable of reacting as either

ampullar.gloss: of or related to an ampulla

ampullary.gloss: of or related to an ampulla

a million times.gloss: by a factor of a million

amidship.gloss: at or near or toward the center of a ship

amidships.gloss: at or near or toward the center of a ship

amply.gloss: to an ample degree or in an ample manner

amusingly.gloss: in an entertaining and amusing manner
